alert.note: Alert for Southern Penobscot (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 5:14PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of south central Penobscot County through 600 PM EDT... At 514 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Hampden to near Winterport. Movement was northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bangor, Orono, Brewer, Hampden, Hermon, Veazie, Orrington, Holden, Carmel, Eddington, Newburgh and Bradley. This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 between mile markers 173 and 190. State Highway 9 between Newburgh and Eddington. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
